Future Work

Some ideas for future work on Goldie:

(Bold is high priority)

  • #3: Lex/parse from a stream
  • #8: Ability to "step through" lexing and parsing
  • #9: Support for "indentation increase/decrease" virtual terminals
  • #10: Write an alternative to JsonViewer from scratch in D
  • #14: Support new GOLD v5.0 features
  • #15: Support for custom virtual terminals
  • Better API for manipulating parse trees once they're built
  • More error checking on .cgt loading, and an optional "lenient loading" mode
  • Enhancements to the base GOLD capabilities
  • Optional alternate to .cgt format
  • Support for "Composed" grammars (ex: C with preprocessor, C# with XML-doc-comments, PHP/Classic ASP with HTML)
  • More types of parsing than just LALR(1)
  • Make download/installation simpler.
  • Allow parsing at compile-time (may require improvements to D's CTFE)
  • Add a way to automatically map a parse tree into an AST.
  • Better API for semantic errors and custom user-made errors.
  • Consider replacing GenDocs with DDoc.
